snippet: Not a single one of the nearly 18,000 homes destroyed or severely damaged in last summer’s war is habitable, despite an Israeli mechanism to approve reconstruction.
abstract: Gaza City residents are frustrated with rebuilding process meant to reconstruct or repair damage caused by fierce 2014 Israeli-Palestinian battle; experts say reconstruction is hampered by political infighting, Israeli-centric approval process, lack of money and narrow development plan and that does not address infrastructure, housing shortages and local economic issues.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and MAJD AL WAHEIDI

lead_paragraph: Not a single one of the nearly 18,000 homes destroyed or severely damaged in last summer’s war is habitable, despite an Israeli mechanism to approve reconstruction.

headline.main: One Year After War, People of Gaza Still Sit Among the Ruins
headline.print_headline: Gaza Is Still in Ruins One Year After War
